FuncDef:
The mld snooping enable command enables MLD snooping in a specified VLAN.
The undo mld snooping enable command disables MLD snooping in a specified VLAN. The mld snooping enable command enables MLD snooping in a specified VLAN. The undo mld snooping enable command disables MLD snooping in a specified VLAN. By default, MLD snooping is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: MLD snooping runs on a Layer 2 device between a Layer 3 multicast device and user hosts. MLD snooping listens on multicast protocol messages exchanged between the Layer 3 device and user hosts to maintain forwarding entries of multicast packets. MLD snooping manages and controls forwarding of multicast data packets. Enabling MLD snooping is the prerequisite for implementing Layer 2 multicast. You can run this command to enable MLD snooping in a specified VLAN.
